item.title: LaTeX on Blogger again
item.description: MathJax.Hub.Config({tex2jax: {inlineMath: [['$','$'], ['\\(','\\)']]}}); My previous post about LaTeX  on Blogger reported that the solution described there did not work anymore... Now I found a new solution based on mathjax. So let's try it straight away with inline math, like the great equation \(e^{-2\pi}\), and with displayed math like the following: \[ \left [ - \frac{\hbar^2}{2 m} \frac{\partial^2}{\partial x^2} + V \right ] \Psi = i \hbar \frac{\partial}{\partial t} \Psi \]

item.title: LaTeX on Blogger
item.description: An inline snippet of LaTeX \(e^{\pi i}+1=0\) in blogger (from http://watchmath.com/vlog/?p=438 but it now, Oct 2010, shows crap!). You can as well have it in display style \[e^{\pi i}+1=0\].
